results.brief_description: Shows the four main fishing grounds of the world and discusses all aspects of the fishing industry.

results.title: The Fishermen of Quintay
results.brief_description: The Chilean Government’s decision that life in the isolated fishing villages must be improved brought two visitors - a Chilean Inspector of Fisheries and a UN Fisheries expert to the village of Quintay. The people of this community were anxious for progress, but they could do little to help due to poverty. The UN expert suggested that the fishermen form a co-operative for selling their fish and buying supplies. As a result life in this remote Chilean village has been raised to a new level.

results.title: Fishermen
results.creator_credit: Guy L. Cote and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Should he choose to stay boss of his own boat and hope for better catches, or seek a job in commercial fishing, trading independence for a more certain income? This film is about the choice that faces many of Canada’s east-coast fishermen. (Awards: Berlin; Bloemfontein; Columbus)

results.title: Fisherman's gamble
results.creator_credit: Ray Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A sea hunt for swordfish off the Nova Scotia coast. A swordfish is more like a torpedo than a fish and, with five feet of boat-piercing armour for a nose, it is almost as deadly. Catching one is an exciting test of strength, with some anxious moments.

results.title: The Fisherman's boy
results.brief_description: Explains some of the operations of a commercial fishing boat on a large lake. Tells how the captain’s small son learns to fish with a bobber from the dock before he is allowed to accompany his father on the boat.

results.title: The Fisherman and his wife
results.creator_credit: Gisela Frisen, Per Ekholm and Minimal Produkten
results.brief_description: This is the tale of a poor fisherman who catches an enchanted fish. His wife demands that he ask the fish to grant him a wish but the fish teaches the ambitious wife a lesson about wishing for too much. Puppets in silhouette are used to translate this Brothers Grimm fairytale.

results.title: The Fisherman
results.creator_credit: Stanley Dalby, Brian Woods, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Centred on the southern New South Wales coastal town of Eden, this film looks at the background of one of Australia’s basic primary industries - tuna fishing. The film examines the daily routine of one of the typical fishing families in the town.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stanley Dalby, Brian Woods, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Fishery in Japan
results.brief_description: Fish plays a large part in the diet of the Japanese people, providing them with much needed protein. It is eaten in various forms, some of which are a delight to the eye as well as the palate. Japan has one of the world’s largest and most efficient fishing industries, all types of fishing operations, coastal and deep-sea, canning and freezing operations are shown.

results.title: Fish spoilage control
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon illustrating bacteriological contamination of fish and correct methods of handling to ensure freshness from boat to dinner table. The spoilage process is portrayed by battalions of little red demons, who march in full invading force upon the hapless forms of freshly caught fish. They demonstrate effectively how every act of carelessness in fish handling will increase their numbers, and also how proper refrigeration and sanitary handling will rout them.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Fish run
results.creator_credit: Jack Howells, Jack Flack and Merlin Films
results.brief_description: The daily 300-mile run of heavy transport lorries carrying fish from Aberdeen to Manchester, filmed against an interesting scenic background. On the occasion recorded in the film, the run takes on an added interest as the lorries are testing a new fuel injector pump en route.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Howells, Jack Flack and Merlin Films
